intro: Pseudodissochaeta raphioides, commonly known as the narrow-leaved sandburs, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and Asia. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family and typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments. The plant has small, spiny fruits that are adapted for dispersal by attaching to animal fur or human clothing. Its leaves are narrow and often covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. It is often found in disturbed soils and can be an indicator of dry, sandy habitats.
